comments.name: MATERIAL
comments.text:
As far as visible during the inspection areas of the structure include:
Concrete block framing at the walls and wood framing at the roof

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable
The following concerns were noted at the exterior walls:
Non-professional repairs noted at the stucco in several areas around the house. 
Caulk dropped on the walls around the front porch. Recommend repairing.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Slab is not fully visible.
The following concerns were noted at the slab:
Typical cracks in slab noted.  Some cracking is to be expected as the property settles with age. Recommend monitoring for any future changes.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable
The following concerns were noted at the driveway:
Mortar splattered on the driveway near the stone veneer walls. Recommend cleaning.
Cracks noted.  Some cracking is to be expected as the property settles with age. Recommend monitoring for any future changes.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable

Sprikler system installed on the property. Inspection of these systems is outside the scope of a home inspection however a courtesy inspection was performed and the system appears serviceable. 
The following concerns were noted at the sprinkler system:
Zone 6 is not working.  Recommend evaluation by a qualified licensed contractor and repair or replace as needed.

comments.name: SITE
comments.text:
Gentle slope
Grade at foundation appears serviceable
The following concerns were noted with grading:
Soil was not properly graded under the SOD and is severely uneven throughout the yard. Recommend correction

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable
The following concerns were noted at the patio:
Non-professional repairs noted at the edges of the slab and stucco intersections

comments.name: TYPE
comments.text:
Front Porch and Rear Patio:
Same as structure, open design

comments.name: ROOF ACCESS
comments.text:
Walked on roof. Unable to fully access due to design.
Viewed roof with a drone. Limited inspection in some areas.

comments.name: ROOF COVERING STATUS
comments.text:
General condition appears serviceable with signs of weathering and aging. Regular maintenance and inspections are advised. Maintenance will help ensure the weather tightness of the building and should be performed on a regular basis.

The following concerns were noted at the roof:
Paint over sprayed on the shingles. 
Damaged shingle at the front left side of the roof. Recommend replacing.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable
The following concerns were noted at the flashings:
One box vent on the lower right side of the house is bent/damaged. Recommend replacing.

comments.name: TYPE & CONDITION
comments.text:
Full
Appears serviceable
The following concerns were noted at the gutters:
Gutters around the rear patio need the slope to be adjusted. Recommend evaluation by a qualified professional and repair.

comments.name: MATERIAL AND SIZE
comments.text: Main line is 1 inch diameter Plastic/PVC

comments.name: LOCATION
comments.text: Main water shut off valve is located at the left side of the building

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text: Appears serviceable, valve is operational, water pressure appears adequate.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable
Plumbing vents appear serviceable

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable
Pressure relief valve noted not tested
A water shutoff valve is installed

comments.name: MAIN PANEL CONDITION
comments.text:
Circuit and wire sizing correct so far as visible
Grounding system is present

comments.name: PANEL CONDITION
comments.text:
Circuit and wire sizing correct so far as visible
Grounding system is present

Missing one screw in the panel cover

comments.name: BRANCH WIRING CIRCUIT CONDUCTORS
comments.text:
Type of conductor noted:
Non-Metallic cable with Metal/Plastic conduit

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Accessible switches and receptacles were tested.  As a whole receptacles and switches throughout the building are in serviceable condition.

The following concerns were noted with the switches and receptacles:
Several receptacles throughout the house are upside down. Recommend adjusting.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Accessible lights were tested.  As a whole lighting throughout the building is in serviceable condition.

The following concerns were noted with the lights:
Several light fixtures are missing.  Recommend installing

comments.name: CONDITION OF SINK
comments.text:
Sink appears serviceable
Fixtures appear serviceable
Drain appear serviceable
Counters/cabinets appear serviceable.

comments.name: TUB/SHOWER PLUMBING FIXTURES
comments.text:
Fixtures appear serviceable
Drain appears serviceable
Shower head appears serviceable

comments.name: TUB/SHOWER AND WALLS
comments.text:
The following concerns were noted at the shower:
Several wall tiles are crooked. 
Missing grout in several areas. 
Threshold is loose. 
Gaps under the threshold and at the joints. Recommend evaluation by a qualified licensed contractor and repair or replace.

comments.name: CONDITION OF SINK
comments.text:
Sink appears serviceable
Fixtures appear serviceable
Drain appear serviceable
Counters/cabinets appear serviceable.

The following concerns were noted at the bathroom sink:
Minor leak under the sink in the cabinet. Unable to locate the leak. Recommend evaluation by a qualified licensed plumber and repair or replace.

comments.name: TUB/SHOWER PLUMBING FIXTURES
comments.text:
Fixtures appear serviceable
Drain appears serviceable
Shower head appears serviceable

comments.name: TUB/SHOWER AND WALLS
comments.text:
Shower areas appear serviceable

Tile noted at walls. Unable to verify substrate preparation techniques.  Recommend regular grouting sealing and caulking to maintain integrity.

comments.name: CONDITION OF SINK
comments.text:
Sink appears serviceable
Fixtures appear serviceable
Drain appear serviceable
Counters/cabinets appear serviceable.

The following concerns were noted at the bathroom sink:
Minor leak under the sink in the cabinet. Recommend evaluation by a qualified licensed plumber and repair.

comments.name: TUB/SHOWER PLUMBING FIXTURES
comments.text:
Fixtures appear serviceable
Drain appears serviceable
Shower head appears serviceable

comments.name: TUB/SHOWER AND WALLS
comments.text:
Tub and shower areas appear serviceable

Tile noted at walls. Unable to verify substrate preparation techniques.  Recommend regular grouting sealing and caulking to maintain integrity.

The following concerns were noted at the tub/shower:
Missing caulk and grout in several areas. Recommend using sanded grout at the tub and tile intersections and tile and window intersections. 
Tub is noisy when standing in it and moving. Recommend evaluation by a qualified professional and repair or replace.

comments.name: LOCATION
comments.text: Attached two car garage with side storage garage.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text: Same as building, see building roof report

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable
Cracks noted.  Some cracking is to be expected as the property settles with age. Recommend monitoring for any future changes.
Floor was coated. Verify material and process used.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable
Automatic door opener(s)- operational
Electric eye automatic reverse feature is operational
Pressure sensitive safety reverse feature was not tested as part of this inspection due to the risk of damage to the garage door in the event of an inoperable/not installed pressure sensitive device.

Remove the secondary locks on both doors. 

The following concerns were noted with the vehicle door:
Large door appears to stick to the slab and causing the door to trip a sensor and not open. Recommend evaluation by a qualified professional and repair as needed.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appear serviceable
Non-professional repairs noted by the exterior door and water heater

comments.name: MAIN ENTRY DOOR
comments.text:
Appears serviceable
The following concerns were noted at the main entry door:
Non-professional screw hole patches. 
Deadbolt doesnt lock properly. Recommend repairing

comments.name: OTHER EXTERIOR DOORS
comments.text:
Sliding glass door
Exterior garage door
Appears serviceable. 

The following concerns were noted at the doors:
Garage door rubs the frame when closing. Recommend adjusting. 
Blinds on the sliding glass door are damaged. Recommend replacing

comments.name: INTERIOR DOORS
comments.text:
Appears serviceable
The following concerns were noted at the interior doors:
Chipped paint on the upstairs hall bathroom door. 
Poor craftsmanship at the wood chiseling work at the strike plates on several doors. Recommend repairing

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text: Accessible windows were inspected.  Windows as a grouping are generally operational and appear serviceable. Monitor for problems.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
General condition appears serviceable
The following concerns were noted at the interior walls:
Uneven wall in the living room. 
Below average Sheetrock work throughout the house. Several seams are visible, nail pops in some areas, uneven mudwork and texture throughout. Recommend evaluation by a qualified professional and repair or replace.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
General condition appears serviceable

The following concerns were noted at the ceilings:
Non-professional repairs noted throughout the house in several areas. 
Cracked ceiling by the kitchen and stairway. 
Uneven/sagging portions of the ceiling in some areas. Recommend evaluation by a qualified professional and repair or replace.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
General condition appears serviceable
The following concerns were noted with the floors:
Spacers and thinset sticking out of the grout in several areas. 
Missing transitions at the tile and carpet intersections.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Interior stairs appear serviceable
Stair handrails appear serviceable

comments.name: FRAMING
comments.text: Truss framing noted. Truss framing is an engineered support system and is not intended to be cut or altered in any way without engineer approval.

comments.name: ACCESSIBILITY
comments.text: Restricted access due to attic design. Only partially entered/partially inspected.

comments.name: VENTILATION
comments.text:
Attic ventilation is provided by Soffit vents and Stationary vents
Appears serviceable

comments.name: INSULATION CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable
The following concerns were noted at the attic insulation:
Some insulation has been moved/disturbed.  Recommend replacing insulation to previous condition.
Add additional insulation as needed.

comments.name: VAPOR BARRIER CONDITION
comments.text: Vapor barrier was not visible during inspection.

comments.name: COMMENTS
comments.text: Smoke detectors are present and were not tested.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Faucet appears serviceable
Hand sprayer appears serviceable
Drain appears serviceable

comments.name: KITCHEN CABINETS/COUNTERTOPS
comments.text:
Cabinets and counter tops appear serviceable

Cabinet base under the sink was repaired during the inspection

comments.name: TYPE
comments.text: Electric Cooktop and a Separate Electric Wall Mounted Oven

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable
The following concerns were noted at the range/cook top and oven:
oven and microwave are slightly crooked. Recommend adjusting.

comments.name: CONDITION
comments.text:
Appears serviceable. 
A quick wash cycle was run at the time of the inspection. 
No leaking noted. 
No other cycles were tested at the time of the inspection. 

The following concerns were noted at the dishwasher:
Handle is loose. 
Door closes crooked. 
Top of dishwasher is scratched from the mounting bracket screw. Recommend evaluation by a qualified repairman/installer and repair or replace

comments.name: WATER AND WASTE CONDITION
comments.text: No washing machine installed. Laundry plumbing was not tested. Inspector is not allowed to operate valves. We Highly recommend verifying proper operation of plumbing before close of transaction.

comments.name: ELECTRICAL AND GAS CONDITION
comments.text: 240V Service-operational and the electrical outlet is grounded

comments.name: GENERAL CONDITION OF CONDENSER - COMPRESSOR
comments.text:
Appears operational

The following concerns were noted with the air conditioning condenser/compressor:
According to the general rule of thumb of 1 ton of cooling capacity per 500 square feet of living area the AC may be undersized for the reported living area. As this is a general rule of thumb and many other factors effect the home's heat load it is recommend that further evaluation be performed by a qualified licensed contractor and repair or replacement be made as needed.

comments.name: EVAPORATOR CONDENSATE LINE AND/PAN
comments.text:
Condensate line installed.
Float switch noted/not tested

comments.name: ACCESS POINT
comments.text: The camera on the sewer scope was inserted at the ground level cleanout on the right side of the house.

comments.name: MATERIAL VIEWED
comments.text:
The following materials were viewed in the sewer scope video feed: 
PVC

comments.name: CONDITIONS/RECOMMENDATIONS
comments.text:
The following concerns were noted in the sewer scope video feed: 
There appears to have been a previous repair on the right side of the house towards the corner of the small garage. The approximate location is marked with a yellow X in the yard. The repair is causing an above average offset in the pipe that may catch debris. Unable to determine how the repaired section was joined with the other ends of the waste line. Recommend evaluation by a qualified licensed plumber and repair or replace.
There is a small portion of the waste line in the yard after the clean-out that is holding sand and water. Monitor regularly. 

View the sewer scope video by clicking the link below: 
https://youtu.be/QYRa1dV9h0w

comments.name: PEOPLE PRESENT
comments.text:
Selling agent
Purchaser
Purchasers spouse
Superintendent
